reviewText: This movie is rude, crude, and lewd.  It offends just about everyone.  That's what makes it so funny.In this politically correct society of ours, we need to let our hair down and have fun occasionally.  It's ok to laugh at sophomoric jokes every once in a while.  Humor is a great stress reliever.  It is good for us emotionally and physically.  So, lighten up and have some fun.If you are too embarrassed or ashamed to admit that this is really funny stuff, watch it alone with the curtains shut.  That way the neighbors won't know that you can't help but laugh at this movie and possibly ruin your reputation. :)
summary: White trash humor at it's best - not for the easily offended

reviewText: I've only seen Larry the Cable guy in a few stand up comedy spots, and since I was pleased with his style, I thought I'd give this movie a go.  I'm glad I did.Even though the plot was a bit weak overall, and I wasn't happy about the ending, good redneck jokes can be located all over the place.  One of my favorite jokes was "she's so ugly she can go trick-or-treating over the phone".Larry the Cable guy had a partner with him throughout the movie, and even though it was a woman, Larry kept treating her like a man by calling her "son" and "guy", which was hysterical.Larry's big redneck truck makes an appearance, and I love that truck!Despite what people might say, the movie was not covered in diarrhea and fart jokes, however, they do appear more often here than in other fart-comedies (for lack of better words).A couple of the main characters, such as Larry's girlfriend and one of his work "friends" have been featured is some quality comedies on the Fox station (Grounded for Life and Arrested Development, respectively).  These characters could have been funnier, but it's not a problem, because the movie was supposed to be about Larry the Cable guy in a comedy role.Of course, Larry the Cable guy is at his very best doing stand up comedy, but for a silly redneck comedy, this is a golden treat.  I enjoyed it, and laughed throughout.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I moderately like Larry's comedy, and as a result I like this movie,  This movie is definitely Larry doing his comedy in a movie rather than in stand-up.  There were quite a few laughs throughtout the movie, more so than recet movies, but it wasn't a constant laugh riot.  If you hate Larry, you'll hate this movie, and if you love Larry, you'll love this movie.Note that this is most definitely not a politically correct movie.  There are plenty of fart and handicapped jokes, with a few gay ones tossed in as well.  If you are offended by those jokes, you shouldn't bother to see this.  Otherwise, you should like the movie just fine, but only the true blue Larry fans will absolutely love this movie.  Thus, 4 stars.
summary: If you like Larry, you'll like this movie.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Oh my God, what has Larry the Cable Guy done? This movie is not even about Health Inspection as much as it is farting, peeing, pooping, etc. Yes, you read right. There is plenty of that in this 1 hour 30 minute movie. Larry the Cable Guy does do some health inspecting, but do not watch the movie for that. If you watch this, watch it because you are either (A) a die-hard Larry the Cable Guy fanatic or (B) a die hard Blue Collar Comedy Tour fanatic. I am B. My favorite of the bunch is Bill "Here's Your Sign" Engvall. My younger brother likes Jeff "You Might Be a Redneck" Foxworthy. My mother likes Ron "They Call me Tater Salad" White. However, only Larry "Git-R-Done" the Cable Guy is in this movie. I would strongly recommend you never see this movie. Instead, rent or buy "Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie." It might just be about stand-up comedy, but it is so very much better. Unless, of coarse, farting, peeing, and pooping is your kind of flick. Hey, if I could get paid to have people hear me fart, maybe I would do it. Maybe that is why Larry the Cable Guy did it. Hey, no disrespect to the man, he should just stay with stand-up, where he is the funniest. So, Git-R-Done!
summary: Larry "Git-R-Done" the Cable Guy at his worst!

reviewText: The debate over this movie appears to be heated. Here are my two cents. I have been a Larry fan for many years and have seen him live several times. The Blue Collar shows/movies are wonderful platforms for Larry to shine. Regretfully, this is not a well written movie and Larry suffers for it.One of the bright spots in the show was the supporting cast. Larry's partner, played by Iris Bahr, shows great talent and promise in her role. She made the most of a quirky character.I would recommend that if you just want to see this movie, rent it. If you are a die-hard Larry fan, go ahead and pick it up for keeps. I'm hoping that Larry gets a second chance to be highlighted as he is absolutely hilarious and could really do well if given a quality script to work with.
summary: I love Larry's stuff but this was just a bad movie
Title: N/A

reviewText: Having seen Larry the Cable Guy in concert I knew this movie would be stupid, but also expected it to be funny. It was stupider than I was prepared for and not as funny as I hoped. There is a mild attempt at a plot and a couple of humorous running gags, one involving Larry getting a female partner but because of how she dresses and wears her hair, he thinks she's a man. Some of the scenes between Larry and his boss are also very funny. And again, knowing it's Larry the Cable Guy, I expected fart and other bodily functions humor, but this movie was unrelenting. It was still making a variation of the same joke right until the end of the movie. At some point you have to move on.
summary: Even dumber than I thought it would be

reviewText: Very interesting concept and framework for a movie, that is what saves this from a 1 star rating.  Larry plays a bachelor, work alone health inspector keeping the city safe from unsafe food.  He has a couple of bad incidents on the job, and gets an unwanted partner to assist.  They have an awkward relationship, but somehow they get placed on "the biggest case ever" that culd effect the City Cook Off finals.  Mayhem ensues.The movie is overall just aweful.  Non-funny fart jokes, and an uniteresting set of characters. Poor timing and set up for a ton of puns.  Donny is about the only funny character, along with the mother. Larry's stand up whityness just does not come through here.  I found myself wanting to switch this off 30 minutes into it, but kept on watching in hopes that it would get better, but it doesn't.  Save your money, borrow this from someone else who rents this.  I hope you didn't see this in the theaters
summary: Just not that funny, even low for larry standards
Title: N/A

reviewText: If someone peeing in a shower made you laugh 'til your ribs hurt...you might be a dummy.Dagnabbit, it kinda pains to be a Southerner and know a thang or two about the Blue Collar comedy troupe.  And I do mean a thang or two, as I only know two people of the four-man group.  Now I ain't a fan of the troupe, because I like to think I am sorta sophisticated on comedy, but I gotta ask to y'all: ain't Jeff Foxworthy a household name to country folks?  Why ain't he taking charge and star in lots of big comedy movies?  How in tarnation is a guy like him, who seems clean and friendly to everybody he be pleasing with, is second to Larry the Cable Guy's load of films?  The ev'ryday redneck, of all Blue Collar comedians, got to lead in three movies (that is three too got dang much) and he even was acartoon tow-truck.  Kinda depressin' that he be a leading man for a movie like Health Inspector, which don't impress me none.From what the story is, Larry is an unlikely health inspector who goes from one restaurant to another to check for some infestations and such, making sure them restaurants are the cleanest places to go.  He was ordered byBiff Tannento pardner up with a tomboyish bookworm gal to observe the pro at play.  They be looking in other places, fighting their odd diff'rences until they found, like, some kind of conspiracy that someone's sabotaging the restaurants so they can win a cooking show for their own personal gain.  Larry don't want that to happen, so he and the boy-girl are on the case. Ironically for a health inspector such as hisself, the man lives in a pigsty.  Y'all understand the word 'irony'?  'Irony' is, like, somethin' that is the opposite of what it is s'pose to be or act.  Y'see, his job is to make sure the restaurants are spotless, and he don't even clean up after himself.  That's the joke, and I am explainin' this to you because this movie thinks you an idjut, like many of them jokes where Larry had to explain why they funny.  I may type like a poorly-done stereotypical redneck, but I would not treat the movie folks like that.I could be talkin' more about unfunny them poopy jokes are, how the characters don't seem to give any better laughs, or how this movie ripped that one toilet scene fromDumb and Dumber, but the thang is, Health Inspector is just ain't for me.  As much as I dun hated his work, he did has an audience that people look up to and this is strictly for these folks.  This is a kinda movie I tend to avoid, but I gave it a chance, I was willin' to see if there is more to Larry than being a flannel shirt and trucker hat-wearing dimwit.  But he is exactly what he looks, and this film ain't converting me to being a fan of his stuff.  I do say that the characters had a few nice qualities about demselves, even the insulting mental one fromdat Foosball spoofis a decent guy, and the film don't try to hurt nobody's feelings, no joke about those.  I guess after watching a show like King of the Hill, movies like this are bottom-grade, no matter how they git-r-done.
summary: No Fun, No Laughs, No How

reviewText: Well, technically, this is the only Larry the Cable Guy movie I've ever seen!  And the in the words of Brent from Season 6 Apprentice!  YOU ALL  STANK!!!!I rented this movie, on the recommendation of a very Movie Oriented friend of mine, named Bobby Asslong.  I think this might be the last recommendation I take from him on comedies.  He seems to favor the bodily function Gross Out Humor films, and I find they are tasteless and vulgar!Okay, like another reviewer here, I'm not a prude.  I saw "Date Movie" and actually thought it was pretty funny.  But there was a big difference.  It wasn't 90% gas and bodily function humor.  This movie was over the top in the Gross factor!  Sorry, when the lady he is trying to attract, is getting the uncomfortable look on her face, listening to him squeeze off gas, as he sits there, supposedly wining and dining her, it makes me feel uncomfortable for her, and most importantly, I stop laughing.  Which would be counter to what a comedy movie is supposed to make you do.  You see my point?Story-line:  Okay, that actually was a strong point, though it was a pretty lousy story, and would not win any awards, this factor does allow it to rise above other "gross out" humor movies like the Satire movies put out in an almost monthly basis.  Of course, there were no earth stopping moments, or amazing cliff hanger plotlines, but I actually found myself curious who and why somebody was poisoning patrons.Low Budget: At the end, when they are rolling credits, and showing film, I assumed that they were showing some type of bloopers, but the story was continuing, and we were seeing new scenes.  Of course, by then, I could care less about these final scenes.  I wanted my 88 minutes back!MC White said:  YOU ALL STANK!
summary: One of the Lousiest Larry Movies I've ever seen!!!

reviewText: yeah, my top worst movies of all time. this ranked up there with Adam Sandler's Going Overboard, The Underground Comedy Movie, Catwoman, The Aristocrats, The Cookout, and a whole bunch of others not even worth mentioning.let's say i didn't go into this movie with low expectations. this movie had more fart jokes then Terrance and Phillip although not as obscene. the plot really didn't matter. it was just Larry the Cable Guy doing his thing. Who cares what really happened. i just wanted to see if this movie was as bad as it sounded. yup, it was. i really actually wanted to give this movie a chance. i wish i was like some of these people who did enjoy it. unfortunately it was too aweful to be of any pleasure to me.so if you really want something redneck and funny, check out either Joe Dirt, which you can see on Comedy Central anytime they have the redneck weekend. or you can check out the unknown but funny as hell movie Run Ronnie Run. I cannot recommend this movie to anyone except the faithful fans of Larry. they are probably the only ones who will thoroughly enjoy this movie for what it's worth. Git-R Dun!

reviewText: I'm a Larry fan, I think he's hilarious and I love almost anything he's ever done.  His new movie though was a head scratcher, it's not a five star classic but it definetely gets enough of a recamendation.The story is enough to fill the slim running time of the movie.  Larry is a slob, plain and simple.  His giant truck is a redneck eyesore, his personal habits and mannerisims are disgusting, he drives his boss nuts and his new partner he keeps thinking is a guy.  Larry is also a health inspector and may be the best one in the city but it's for all the aforementioned traits I listed above plus a destructive streak while on the job that keeps him on the 2 star lower rent beat instead of the gourmet establishments.When a string of food poisonings hit the area Larry is asked by the mayor to investigate, especially with an Iron Chef style cookoff coming up, none of the major establishments are above suspiction of tamering with the competition.  Along the way we see moonpies, a mouthy mom to Larry's sweetie, a horrifying unibrow girl, fart jokes (yes but hey for foodpoisoning you should expect it) and yes Donnie.  The creators must have realized that Larry is no actor and while he doens't do a bad job (he's basically playing himself) he has an excellent supporting cast to help him out especially Tom Wilson, Joe Pantoliano among others to surround Larry and help cover up any jitters.THe movie runs a little short but it's enough to get the story across and not overstay it's welcome.  I may be a Larry fan but I wouldn't listen to him for two hours straight.  The film thankfully follows the logic of Airplane! in that if you have enough jokes a minute even if many are bound to fail, many are bound to work too.  Thankfully thats the case here and if you like Larry then you will love the movie.  If you get a bug up your butt about the jokes in the movie, then don't take it seriously cause not even the movie takes itself that seriously.If I was some uppity snob of a movie critic ready to just write this off and reccamend some Ben Stiller POS, I would have said something along the lines of: "Larry the Cable Guy Health Inspector, is a movie for ugly people by ugly people in which the protaganist the dreary redneck buffoon played by Dan Whitney stumbles through town on a cookie cutter story and managing to upset or offend the sensibilities of anyone unfortuneate enough to meet him.  The movie is for anyone who thinks farts are still funny cause thats all the humor you will find here.  If you want funny, then see Clerks II.  In these days of political correctness, Larry the Cable Guy should be arrested by the thought police since the things he actually says are a capital offence."Yeah, well guess what, if you read that review that probably exists somewhere and agreed with it, and you STILL saw Larry the Cable Guy's movie, you should have seen what was coming 10 minutes ago and not even bothered seeing it and deserved what ever you got for seeing it.  Grow up and cut out the "I'm offended" baloney.ANYWAY like I was saying it's not a classic since it could've used a little more meat on the bones as far as a story goes.  I thought Tom Wilson was great too even though all he does here is basically yell at Larry.  Wish he could have done more.  Maybe for the sequel.git r done!!
summary: Dagum!  Thats *fart* funny right dar' now!
Title: N/A

reviewText: In his feature film debut, Larry the Cable Guy does what all stand up comedians who make it big inevitably do. He crossed over to acting. Larry isn't a bad actor and this film has it's moments of funny stuff, but overall...This isn't really Larry. The script isn't written by Larry, some of the stuff is probably improvised; But, the film suffers from a lame and cliched script. With the plot of the script (and since the film is a comedy), I knew there was going to be plenty of roaches and over-the-top reasons for Larry shutting down restaurants and such. But the film does one thing that so many comedies before it has done wrong...It relies to much on jokes about flatulence rather than genuine humor. Larry plays (of course) Larry, a slobbish health inspector who is pretty good at what he does. His boss doesn't like him though so he assigns Larry a partner. The partner is a straight-laced by the book woman named Amy Butlin (Iris Bahr). One of the movie's running jokes is that Larry is under the impression Butlin is a guy. Anyway, after there are a series of "mishaps" at various 5-star restaurants Larry and Butlin begin to investigate. Along the way, they get to know the seedy mayor M.T. Gunn (Joe Pantoliano, who's got some crazy eyebrow thing going on) and Larry gets a love interest in the form of Jane Whitley (Megyn Price of "Grounded for Life" fame). The movie uses every sick sight gag it can think of to gross you out (after seeing a little film called Pink Flamingos, most gross stuff that happens on screen doesn't affect me anymore). The opening scene (and several later scenes) feature shots of Larry's [...]-crack. The film's strong-point are Larry's one-liners, which I assume are improved. "She's so ugly, she could go trick-or-treating over the telephone" and his trademark "Git R Done" (which he only uses once in the film, I think) are examples of funny stuff. Anyway, this movie IS NOT hilariously funny...You get a few chuckles here and there, but I guess it's what one would expect from Larry the Cable Guy's film debut. You have to expect disgusting things coming from Larry; I mean, it's just like if Ron White was in a movie you'd expect him to play an alcoholic. Anyway, hardcore fans of Larry will love this movie; As will most teenage kids.GRADE: B-
summary: Should've Been Better, But if You're a fan of Larry...

reviewText: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector is a very funny movie if you like the comedy of Larry the Cable Guy himself.  The role model of rednecks will have you chuckling from the opening scene throughout most of the movie.  Very dignified viewers are sure to be turned off by the generic plot (replace a rebel cop with a rebel health inspector) and the abundance of flatulence and toilet humor.  In the end, its funniness outweighs its weaknesses.  Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector doesn't disappoint.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The title says it all. Larry just sees things from a bit different viewpoint, which is what makes him funny. That, and his willingness to excite our "don't do that" imperative that our mothers tried to teach us. Dad could fart and scratch his butt, but mom said that was nasty and that we weren't to do that. I think that may be the underlying cause for a bunch of the reviews this movie is receiving. Larry's doing his best to tell you that we all pee and fart and that maybe it's time to get over wishing things were different.All that aside, I used to be a County Health Inspector. If you think this movie is made up, it's not. This stuff, and more, really happens. Larry's just acting it out. No matter how fancy the restaurant, there are things going on in the kitchen you just don't want to know about. I laughed until I hurt watching this movie. You may not.

reviewText: Have you ever noticed that movies involving idiot behavior by men (Larry TCG, Jim Carrey, Adam Sandler, Andrew Dice Clay, etc.) always seem to include a fine woman who is enamored with him and they usually end up happily...? Have you noticed that politically incorrect humor is often provided by these men behaving idiotically? Men laugh at this stuff because they all know guys like this (it's never themselves, though...) Women hate this stuff for the same reason. Of course it's silly! It's off the charts for non-PC and bodily function humor. Still, I laughed a few times, and chuckled a lot. It was made for this reason. Ladies, I recommend you see some of these films, so you can then say "I told ya so" to those men in your life who may not live up to your standards. Even Knights in Shining Armour pass gas and get diarrhea. I bet you do, too, on occasion. Guys can laugh about it. Life's like that. To ignore some of this stuff is to deny certain consequences of being alive. Sorry ladies...maybe it IS a guy thing...
summary: A guy thing? Ladies, listen up...

reviewText: Way back in 8th grade maybe, I knew a kid named Elia. He was sot of weird... He would go up to you and propose, "If you give me a dollar I'll slam my head as hard as I can on the table." One of my acquaintances, curious but reluctant, retorted with: "Do it first, then I'll give you a dollar." So Elia did. Oh, it was a riot. Every lunch he would give himself a mild concussion for a tiny amount of money. It was hilarious for the first week or so, but people realized he had no qualms whatsoever with hitting his head on the table. It got kind of pathetic, actually, then a wave of sympathy washed over my peers. People began just giving Elia money eventually.This reminds me of Larry the Cable Guy getting a movie deal.

reviewText: I cannot believe I wasted 90 minutes of my life on this crap. I almost NEVER find movies bad. It's happened very few times in my life, but oh my, I cannot seem to find words to describe how bad this movie was. First of all, it was EXTREMELY disgusting. If your idea of a comedy is watching fat men take watery-sounding craps on small toilets, seeing close up shots of peeing in showers, people vomiting violently on restaurant parking lots, and hairy man cracks, then yes, I agree, this is the funniest movie ever made. Yes, I know what you're asking yourself, and the answer is yes: it's worse than BORAT. Yes, BORAT. If you thought nothing could more disgusting than Borat, you haven't seen anything yet. Second, a comedy is supposed to make me laugh because it's laughably funny, not because it's laughably BAD. The storyline is terrible and the acting is a joke. It's just not funny, and it's that simple. Watching my own toenails grow is more fun that watching this movie.Avoid this one like the plague.

reviewText: Larry the cable guy, star of blue collar comedy tour, blue collar tv, and various morning radio shows, has made an attempt at making a movie.  Unfortunately, It would have been better if he would had just left it as a stand up act. Incorperating a stand up comedians work into a movie is a tricky task, and as with many, this movie failed as well.  Just corny overall.  Weak storyline, and I just did not find myself laughing, and Larry is a funny guy. So Unfortunately, the movie just didn't "git r done", so save your money and get one of Larry's CDs or stand up shows.
